intro: Ervum gramineum, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its bright yellow petals and distinctive horn-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppies and related species. Ervum gramineum is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats.
